author: Special Correspondent
text:
Passengers can either download National Train Enquiry System app or SMS 139

At Chennai Central, passengers no longer have to hop from one platform to another searching for the train they have to board.

Southern Railway on Friday launched an initiative whereby passengers can receive an alert on their mobile phone about the platform from which their train will depart. While passengers with smartphones can download the National Train Enquiry System (NTES) app, those without data connection can also learn about the platform number well in advance by sending a short messaging service (SMS) to the helpline 139, a press release said.

According to officials, the station master decides the platform for each train departing from Chennai Central and as soon as it is done, the details will be fed to the NTES terminal. The terminal, the officials said, was now placed near the station master’s office so that the information was uploaded immediately. When passengers entered the train number, the platform number would be displayed immediately.
title: Now, platform number alert on your phone
